business.headline: Stock market opening today: Sensex, Nifty to open flat. Here's whyThe Nifty50 index gained 4.2%, and foreign investors bought shares worth Rs 15,925 l . Thast week. This was the fifth week in a row of buying by foreign portfolio investors.

Stocks to watch on May 19: Bajaj Auto, Delhivery, Dr Reddy's, JSW Steel, BELMany companies will be in focus due to their earnings and key updates, such as Power Grid Corporation of India, Bharat Electronics, DLF, ACME Solar Holdings, Bajaj Auto, Delhivery, Dr Reddy's, JSW Steel, etc.

Bengal to be impacted by Bangladesh import curbs, but nation first: OfficialsThe central government on Saturday imposed port restrictions on the import of a few Bangladeshi goods, such as readymade garments and processed food items.

India restricts Bangladesh imports through northeast check postsA wide range of Bangladeshi products will be restricted via the Integrated Check Posts in the northeastern states of Assam, Meghalaya, Tripura, and Mizoram.

India-US Bilateral Trade Agreement: Final Phase Negotiations Aim For ConclusionUnion Minister Piyush Goyal will lead a team to the United States for trade talks. India and the US are working to finalize the Bilateral Trade Agreement (BTA) by early July. The US President has proposed a trade agreement with India that would have no tariffs on a wide range of American products. The US President stated, 'India is one of the highest tariff nations in the world. It's very hard to sell into India.'

Adani drops Chinese lounge partner DragonPass: What it means for Indian flyersThe move, triggered by rising national security concerns, has ended DragonPass's access to Adani-managed airport lounges across the country.

Why the middle class is chasing expensive brands, explains market expertA market expert noted that nearly 75% of luxury spending today comes from the middle class, not due to rising incomes, but because of social media, marketing tricks, and peer pressure that fuel the urge to appear successful.

Indian traders' body boycotts Turkey and Azerbaijan over support for PakistanThe move comes after both Turkey and Azerbaijan openly showed support for Pakistan, at a time when India is facing sensitive national security challenges.

India-US trade deal: First phase likely to be ready by July 1, say sourcesIndia and the United States are in negotiations for a trade deal, with sources indicating that phase one could be ready by July 1st.

India to grow at 6.3%, ahead of China, US, and European Union: UN reportAccording to the UN's mid-year update of the World Economic Situation and Prospects (WESP), India's growth is being fuelled by strong household spending and solid government investments.

Sensex slips 200 points, Nifty holds ground above 25,000; defence stocks surgeThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 200.15 points to close at 82,330.59, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 42.30 points to end at 25,019.80.

2 IPOs to open next week: Check Belrise Industries, Borana Weaves detailsWhile Belrise Industries will open for bidding on May 21, investors can bid for the IPO of Borana Weaves starting May 20, 2025.

entertainment.headline: Suniel Shetty, Athiya praise KL Rahul after he smashes 5th century at IPLAthiya and her father-actor Suniel Shetty, praised KL Rahul after he smashed a century for at least three different franchises. This came after the Delhi Capitals game against the Gujarat Titans (GT) on May 18.

Resist ageism: Nicole Kidman's advice at Cannes as she champions gender equalityActor Nicole Kidman is 2025's recipient of Women in Motion Award at the Cannes Film Festival. Speaking at the event, she advocated for 'resisting ageism' in the world of cinema.

Nothing, just Ananya Panday recreating Main Tera Tota… with father ChunkyAnanya Panday and her father Chunky Pandey recreated the iconic song 'Main Tera Tota Tu Meri Maina' at a Saturday award function. Videos shared on Ananya's fan pages quickly won hearts online.

Tom Cruise shares glowing praise for rumoured girlfriend Ana de Armas' BallerinaHollywood star Tom Cruise was all praises for rumoured girlfriend Ana de Armas's film 'Ballerina'. He spoke about it during the London premiere of his film 'Mission: Impossible - The Final Reckoning'.

Paresh Rawal confirms Hera Pheri 3 exit, says 'had no creative difference'Bollywood actor Paresh Rawal has announced his exit from the eagerly-awaited film Hera Pheri 3, clarifying that it is not due to creative differences. He expressed his respect and faith in the director Priyadarshan.

Sonu Kakkar reunites with Neha-Tony for parents' anniversary after family riftAfter publicly acknowledging a rift with her family, singer Sonu Kakkar was seen celebrating her parents' anniversary. The pictures also featured her siblings, Neha and Tony Kakkar.

Mission Impossible 8 box office Day 1: Tom Cruise film opens strong at Rs 17.5 cr'Mission: Impossible – The Final Reckoning' has made a grand entry in India, releasing six days ahead of the global launch and receiving an enthusiastic response from Indian audiences. The film has become the highest-opening Hollywood film of 2025.

Gram Chikitsalaya: Amol Parashar's show is a healing touch, diagnosing deeper truth'Gram Chikitsalaya' is about a doctor trying to make a village more aware of the healthcare system that they need, but it is also about a deep understanding of the neglected rural population of the country. The series is headlined by Amol Parashar as Dr Prabhat Sinha.

Malti's adorable tea party with Priyanka Chopra's manager is the cutest thingPriyanka Chopra's daughter, Malti, hosted an adorable tea party for her mother's manager. Sweet moments from their intimate celebration were shared online on Sunday.

Guns N Roses: Ecstatic fans say 'even gods wanted this to happen' after Mumbai showGuns N' Roses rocked Mumbai on Saturday with an electrifying performance. Elated fans shared highlights from the unforgettable night on their respective X handles.

Singer Rahul Vaidya thanks Virat Kohli for unblocking him: You are pride of IndiaAfter previously calling Virat Kohli and his fans "jokers," singer Rahul Vaidya has now thanked the cricketer for unblocking him on Instagram. Sharing a screenshot of his post, Vaidya praised Kohli, calling him the pride of India.

Aishwarya-Abhishek groove to Kajra Re at wedding, daughter Aaradhya joinsVideos of Aishwarya Rai and Abhishek Bachchan from a recent wedding are now going viral. The clips were shared by singer Rahul Vaidya, who performed at the event.

Babil Khan exits Sai Rajesh's film after backlash: Things didn't go as plannedActor Babil Khan has confirmed exiting director Sai Rajesh's upcoming movie. The duo shared respective posts on social media expressing admiration for each other.

Haqeeqat, a war film forged in India's steely defiance in defeatHaqeeqat (1964) vividly portrays the bravery and sacrifice of Indian soldiers during the 1962 Sino-Indian war. The film combines gripping war scenes, patriotic music, and emotional storytelling to honour the heroes of Rezang La.

Thug Life trailer review: Kamal Haasan, STR in a gangster tale more like Nayakan 2.0The trailer of Mani Ratnam's much-anticipated film 'Thug Life', starring Kamal Haasan, offered a stylish peek into a familiar gangster world, but with the director's signature storytelling depth and visual grandeur. The film also stars Trisha Krishnan.

Vijay Deverakonda wants more films with Rashmika, says 'chemistry not a problem'Actor Vijay Deverakonda candidly spoke about his marriage plans, his on-screen chemistry with Rashmika Mandanna, and whether he's currently seeking a life partner. The duo has long been rumoured to be in a relationship.

Ravi Mohan's ex-mother-in-law breaks silence amid row: Still want him as our heroAarti's mother and producer Sujatha Vijayakumar has responded to serious allegations by actor Ravi Mohan, clarifying her financial dealings and appealing for family peace. She shared a two-page statement on Saturday.

Siddharth Nigam was unaware of YRF before Dhoom 3: Mumbai bula ke bech diya tohActor Siddharth Nigam shares his initial disbelief and fears when auditioning for Dhoom 3. He felt the casting call was fake and feared that he would be trafficked.

Cannes becoming fashion event more than film festival? Actor Rahul Bhat answersRahul Bhat shares his perspective on the Cannes Film Festival, emphasising it as a celebration of cinema rather than just fashion. He is attending Cannes for the third time this year.

general news.headline: UP man arrested on charges of spying for Pak, was in constant touch with ISIArrested from Moradabad in Uttar Pradesh, Shehzad had repeatedly visited Pakistan, smuggled goods across the border, and allegedly passed classified Indian security information to ISI agents.

Police foil bomb plot in Hyderabad, 2 ISIS-linked suspects arrestedPolice foiled an ISIS-linked bomb plot in Hyderabad, arresting two suspects, Siraj and Sameer, in a joint Telangana-Andhra operation.

News Menu, May 19: Parliament panel briefing on Op Sindoor, India-US trade dealIndia Today's Monday news menu dishes out a sharp blend of Operation Sindoor updates, politics over diplomatic delegations, espionage scandals, crucial trade negotiations, and the latest in the Sambhal dispute, all prepared for your day.

Joe Biden, 82, diagnosed with aggressive form of prostate cancerFormer US President Joe Biden has been diagnosed with an aggressive form of prostate cancer that has spread to his bones. His team says the cancer is hormone-sensitive and treatment options are being explored with doctors and family.

Watch: Army officer on how India rained fire on Pak posts after civilians targetedIndia Today's Gaurav Sawant interviewed an Indian Army officer in Jammu and Kashmir, who detailed how India launched fierce retaliation against Pakistani army posts.

Hyderabad blaze: Eyewitness recalls lifeless woman clutching dead childrenZahid, who runs a bangles business in nearby Gulzar House, quickly rushed to the spot with his friends to come to the family's aid. Instead, what they found upon breaking into the fire-engulfed house was a string of dead bodies -- the lifeless body of a woman clinging to the charred bodies of children.

Arrested YouTuber Jyoti Malhotra was being developed as Pak asset: CopsA day after YouTuber Jyoti Malhotra 's arrest over allegedly spying for Pakistan, the police explained how Pakistan's intelligence operatives were using Indian social media influencers to 'push their narrative'.

Who was Saifullah Khalid, LeT's elusive shadow commander killed in PakRazaullah Nizamani Khalid, also known as Abu Saifullah Khalid, was a key Lashkar-e-Taiba operative and mastermind behind the 2006 RSS headquarters attack, the 2008 CRPF Rampur camp strike, and the 2005 IISc Bengaluru attack.

How Gill and Sudharsan built one of IPL's most prolific partnershipsShubman Gill and Sai Sudharsan have formed one of IPL's most prolific opening partnerships. Their trust and low-risk style have propelled Gujarat to the IPL playoffs and set new partnership records.
An Architectural Trail in GujaratPress Release | Vadnagar has substantial remains of its ancient Buddhist heritage.

Question of respect: Chief Justice flags 'protocol lapse' during Maharashtra visitChief Justice BR Gavai, during his first visit to Maharashtra, said that senior state officials —including the Chief Secretary, DGP, and Mumbai Police Commissioner — were absent to receive him.
Bhopal man approaches woman after her breakup, killed by her ex-loverA woman's ex-boyfriend stabbed another man to death when he came to know that he was approaching her after their breakup.

Resist ageism: Nicole Kidman's advice at Cannes as she champions gender equalityActor Nicole Kidman is 2025's recipient of Women in Motion Award at the Cannes Film Festival. Speaking at the event, she advocated for 'resisting ageism' in the world of cinema.

Weapons of mass dissemination: The India-Pakistan cyber frontierOperation Sindoor and the adversary's response to it weren't solely military. A parallel digital war raged, with deepfakes, bots and troll farms as new ammo

How 'Haldi Ghati' exercise helped India mobilise military rapidly for Op SindoorThe 'Haldi Ghati' military exercise was key in integrating air defence and joint command systems, enabling swift and coordinated action across the Army, Navy and the Air Force during Operation Sindoor.

1 Game, 3 Winners: Gujarat, Punjab, and Bengaluru qualify for IPL 2025 playoffsGujarat Titans took RCB and PBKS into playoffs of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025) with a comprehensive 10-wicket win over Delhi Capitals (DC).
Watch: Car rams another, then crashes into shop, passengers casually step out The CCTV footage shows the severity of the collision and the narrow escape of bystanders.
4 children playing in car die of suffocation after door locksFour children had come to attend a wedding in the village when they were locked inside a car while playing.

Beaten, starved, isolated: How Australian man survived five years in Chinese prisonAustralian Matthew Radalj shares his harrowing story after spending five years in a Chinese prison, describing torture, forced confessions, filthy conditions, and solitary confinement.

Bangladeshi actor who played Sheikh Hasina in Mujib biopic arrested in DhakaBangladeshi actor Nusraat Faria was arrested at the Dhaka airport on charges of attempted murder in a case related to the mass uprising against then-PM Sheikh Hasina. Faria played the role of Hasina in the 2023 film 'Mujib: The Making of a Nation'.

As another Gujarat family dies at US border, why 'America at all costs' still luresDespite warnings and crackdowns, the cycle of hope and heartbreak continues, with far too many having paid the ultimate price

Rains to lash several states from May 20 due to cyclonic activity in Arabian seaAccording to the India Meteorological Department forecast, an upper air cyclonic circulation is expected to form over the east-central Arabian Sea, off the Karnataka coast, around May 21.
Sailors dangle high above water after Mexican Navy ship hits Brooklyn Bridge A Mexican Navy training ship, the Cuauhtémoc, collided with the Brooklyn Bridge in New York around 8:26 pm.

BJP keeps winning elections because Opposition is 'nakaam': Asaduddin OwaisiResponding to allegations that AIMIM was the BJP's 'B-team', Asaduddin Owaisi said such attempts showed the opposition parties' hatred of his party and said they were a "failure" as they couldn't stop the BJP from winning elections.

sports.headline: Max Verstappen admits his Imola win surprised him: Didn't think I'd winFormula 1: Max Verstappen turned a weekend of doubt into triumph at Imola, securing Red Bull's milestone 400th race victory and tightening the title race with a win he hadn't expected to even compete for.

Sinner jokes brother chose Formula 1 over watching his final vs AlcarazDespite losing the Italian Open final, Jannik Sinner kept spirits high with a cheeky remark about his brother missing the match for Formula 1, while Carlos Alcaraz claimed his first Rome title and continued his clay dominance.

Rahul Dravid defends Dhruv Jurel after yet another close defeat in IPL 2025Rajasthan Royals' head coach Rahul Dravid came to the defence of young players like Dhruv Jurel after another failed run chase dented their IPL 2025 campaign. Dravid blamed both finishing issues and bowling lapses, while urging patience with the team's young Indian core.

How Gill and Sudharsan built one of IPL's most prolific partnershipsShubman Gill and Sai Sudharsan have formed one of IPL's most prolific opening partnerships. Their trust and low-risk style have propelled Gujarat to the IPL playoffs and set new partnership records.

One spot, three teams: Battle for IPL playoffs explainedPL 2025: Three teams - Gujarat, Punjab and Bengaluru - confirmed their spots in the playoffs on Sunday. With just one place up for grabs, three teams - Mumbai, Lucknow and Delhi - remain in the race

Captain Shubman Gill delighted to evolve as Gujarat Titans storm into playoffsShubman Gill said that he's delighted to evolve from his learning curve as captain, as Gujarat Titans qualified for the playoffs of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025), following a comprehensive 10-wicket win over Delhi Capitals (DC).

Carlos Alcaraz spoils Sinner's Rome party, asserts Roland Garros favourite statusItalian Open 2025: Carlos Alcaraz reaffirmed his status as the favourite to defend his French Open crown by hammering World No. 1 Jannik Sinner in straight sets in the final in Rome on Sunday. The defeat ended Sinner's unbeaten run in the 2025 season.

Shreyas Iyer becomes 1st captain to lead 3 different teams to IPL playoffsPunjab Kings have qualified for the IPL 2025 playoffs for the first time since 2014. Shreyas Iyer became the first captain to lead three different franchises into the IPL playoffs, marking a unique achievement.

Sai Sudharsan 108 trumps KL Rahul's 112 as GT storm into playoffsGujarat Titans secured a spot in the IPL 2025 playoffs after a commanding 10-wicket win against Delhi Capitals. Their strategic batting and top performances from Sudharsan and Shubman Gill highlighted the team's strong title ambitions this season.

DC vs GT: Kuldeep Yadav risks sanction after snapping at umpire over LBW callIPL 2025, DC vs GT: Kuldeep Yadav lost his cool after his LBW appeal against Sai Sudharsan was overturned. Gujarat Titans dominated the Capitals in a high-stakes match on Sunday.

1 Game, 3 Winners: Gujarat, Punjab, and Bengaluru qualify for IPL 2025 playoffsGujarat Titans took RCB and PBKS into playoffs of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025) with a comprehensive 10-wicket win over Delhi Capitals (DC).

Carlos Alcaraz spoils Sinner's Rome party, asserts Roland Garros favourite statusItalian Open 2025: Carlos Alcaraz reaffirmed his status as the favourite to defend his French Open crown by hammering World No. 1 Jannik Sinner in straight sets in the final in Rome on Sunday. The defeat ended Sinner's unbeaten run in the 2025 season.

Shreyas Iyer becomes 1st captain to lead 3 different teams to IPL playoffsPunjab Kings have qualified for the IPL 2025 playoffs for the first time since 2014. Shreyas Iyer became the first captain to lead three different franchises into the IPL playoffs, marking a unique achievement.

Sai Sudharsan 108 trumps KL Rahul's 112 as GT storm into playoffsGujarat Titans secured a spot in the IPL 2025 playoffs after a commanding 10-wicket win against Delhi Capitals. Their strategic batting and top performances from Sudharsan and Shubman Gill highlighted the team's strong title ambitions this season.

DC vs GT: Kuldeep Yadav risks sanction after snapping at umpire over LBW callIPL 2025, DC vs GT: Kuldeep Yadav lost his cool after his LBW appeal against Sai Sudharsan was overturned. Gujarat Titans dominated the Capitals in a high-stakes match on Sunday.

1 Game, 3 Winners: Gujarat, Punjab, and Bengaluru qualify for IPL 2025 playoffsGujarat Titans took RCB and PBKS into playoffs of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025) with a comprehensive 10-wicket win over Delhi Capitals (DC).

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
